updateServiceNotification.description: A service notification from the server was received. Upon receiving this the application must show a popup with the content of the notification

type.description: Notification type. If type begins with "AUTH_KEY_DROP_", then two buttons "Cancel" and "Log out" must be shown under notification; if user presses the second, all local data must be destroyed using Destroy method

updateFile.description: Information about a file was updated

updateFileGenerationStart.description: The file generation process needs to be started by the application. Use setFileGenerationProgress and finishFileGeneration to generate the file

generation_id.description: Unique identifier for the generation process

original_path.description: The original path specified by the application in inputFileGenerated

destination_path.description: The path to a file that must be created and where the new file must be generated by the application. If the application has no access to the path, it can use writeGeneratedFilePart to generate the file

conversion.description: If the conversion is "#url#" than original_path contains an HTTP/HTTPS URL of a file that must be downloaded by the application. Otherwise, this is the conversion specified by the application in inputFileGenerated

updateFileGenerationStop.description: File generation is no longer needed

generation_id.description: Unique identifier for the generation process

updateFileDownloads.description: The state of the file download list has changed

total_size.description: Total size of files in the file download list, in bytes

total_count.description: Total number of files in the file download list

downloaded_size.description: Total downloaded size of files in the file download list, in bytes

updateFileAddedToDownloads.description: A file was added to the file download list. This update is sent only after file download list is loaded for the first time

counts.description: New number of being downloaded and recently downloaded files found

updateFileDownload.description: A file download was changed. This update is sent only after file download list is loaded for the first time

complete_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the file downloading was completed; 0 if the file downloading isn't completed

is_paused.description: True, if downloading of the file is paused

counts.description: New number of being downloaded and recently downloaded files found

updateFileRemovedFromDownloads.description: A file was removed from the file download list. This update is sent only after file download list is loaded for the first time

counts.description: New number of being downloaded and recently downloaded files found

updateApplicationVerificationRequired.description: A request can't be completed unless application verification is performed; for official mobile applications only. The method setApplicationVerificationToken must be called once the verification is completed or failed

verification_id.description: Unique identifier for the verification process

nonce.description: Unique base64url-encoded nonce for the classic Play Integrity verification (https://developer.android.com/google/play/integrity/classic) for Android, or a unique string to compare with verify_nonce field from a push notification for iOS

cloud_project_number.description: Cloud project number to pass to the Play Integrity API on Android

updateApplicationRecaptchaVerificationRe.description: A request can't be completed unless reCAPTCHA verification is performed; for official mobile applications only. The method setApplicationVerificationToken must be called once the verification is completed or failed

verification_id.description: Unique identifier for the verification process

updateCall.description: New call was created or information about a call was updated

updateGroupCall.description: Information about a group call was updated

group_call.description: New data about the group call

updateGroupCallParticipant.description: Information about a group call participant was changed. The updates are sent only after the group call is received through getGroupCall and only if the call is joined or being joined

updateGroupCallParticipants.description: The list of group call participants that can send and receive encrypted call data has changed; for group calls not bound to a chat only

participant_user_ids.description: New list of group call participant user identifiers. The identifiers may be invalid or the corresponding users may be unknown. The participants must be shown in the list of group call participants even there is no information about them

updateGroupCallVerificationState.description: The verification state of an encrypted group call has changed; for group calls not bound to a chat only

generation.description: The call state generation to which the emoji corresponds. If generation is different for two users, then their emoji may be also different

emojis.description: Group call state fingerprint represented as 4 emoji; may be empty if the state isn't verified yet

updateUserPrivacySettingRules.description: Some privacy setting rules have been changed

updateUnreadMessageCount.description: Number of unread messages in a chat list has changed. This update is sent only if the message database is used

chat_list.description: The chat list with changed number of unread messages

unread_unmuted_count.description: Total number of unread messages in unmuted chats

updateUnreadChatCount.description: Number of unread chats, i.e. with unread messages or marked as unread, has changed. This update is sent only if the message database is used

chat_list.description: The chat list with changed number of unread messages

total_count.description: Approximate total number of chats in the chat list

unread_unmuted_count.description: Total number of unread unmuted chats

marked_as_unread_count.description: Total number of chats marked as unread

marked_as_unread_unmuted_count.description: Total number of unmuted chats marked as unread

story.description: The new information about the story

error_type.description: Type of the error; may be null if unknown

updateStoryListChatCount.description: Number of chats in a story list has changed

updateTrendingStickerSets.description: The list of trending sticker sets was updated or some of them were viewed

updateSavedAnimations.description: The list of saved animations was updated

for_dark_theme.description: True, if default background for dark theme has changed

updateChatThemes.description: The list of available chat themes has changed

chat_themes.description: The new list of chat themes

updateAccentColors.description: The list of supported accent colors has changed

colors.description: Information about supported colors; colors with identifiers 0 (red), 1 (orange), 2 (purple/violet), 3 (green), 4 (cyan), 5 (blue), 6 (pink) must always be supported and aren't included in the list. The exact colors for the accent colors with identifiers 0-6 must be taken from the app theme

available_accent_color_ids.description: The list of accent color identifiers, which can be set through setAccentColor and setChatAccentColor. The colors must be shown in the specified order

updateConnectionState.description: The connection state has changed. This update must be used only to show a human-readable description of the connection state

updateFreezeState.description: The freeze state of the current user's account has changed

is_frozen.description: True, if the account is frozen

terms_of_service_id.description: Identifier of the terms of service

updateUnconfirmedSession.description: The first unconfirmed session has changed

session.description: The unconfirmed session; may be null if none

updateAttachmentMenuBots.description: The list of bots added to attachment or side menu has changed

bots.description: The new list of bots. The bots must not be shown on scheduled messages screen

updateWebAppMessageSent.description: A message was sent by an opened Web App, so the Web App needs to be closed

updateActiveEmojiReactions.description: The list of active emoji reactions has changed

emojis.description: The new list of active emoji reactions

updateAvailableMessageEffects.description: The list of available message effects has changed

reaction_effect_ids.description: The new list of available message effects from emoji reactions

sticker_effect_ids.description: The new list of available message effects from Premium stickers

updateDefaultReactionType.description: The type of default reaction has changed

reaction_type.description: The new type of the default reaction

updateDefaultPaidReactionType.description: The type of default paid reaction has changed

type.description: The new type of the default paid reaction

updateSavedMessagesTags.description: Tags used in Saved Messages or a Saved Messages topic have changed

saved_messages_topic_id.description: Identifier of Saved Messages topic which tags were changed; 0 if tags for the whole chat has changed

updateActiveLiveLocationMessages.description: The list of messages with active live location that need to be updated by the application has changed. The list is persistent across application restarts only if the message database is used

messages.description: The list of messages with active live locations

updateOwnedStarCount.description: The number of Telegram Stars owned by the current user has changed

star_amount.description: The new amount of owned Telegram Stars

updateChatRevenueAmount.description: The revenue earned from sponsored messages in a chat has changed. If chat revenue screen is opened, then getChatRevenueTransactions may be called to fetch new transactions

updateStarRevenueStatus.description: The Telegram Star revenue earned by a bot or a chat has changed. If Telegram Star transaction screen of the chat is opened, then getStarTransactions may be called to fetch new transactions

owner_id.description: Identifier of the owner of the Telegram Stars

updateSpeechRecognitionTrial.description: The parameters of speech recognition without Telegram Premium subscription has changed

max_media_duration.description: The maximum allowed duration of media for speech recognition without Telegram Premium subscription, in seconds

weekly_count.description: The total number of allowed speech recognitions per week; 0 if none

left_count.description: Number of left speech recognition attempts this week

next_reset_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the weekly number of tries will reset; 0 if unknown

updateDiceEmojis.description: The list of supported dice emojis has changed

emojis.description: The new list of supported dice emojis

updateAnimatedEmojiMessageClicked.description: Some animated emoji message was clicked and a big animated sticker must be played if the message is visible on the screen. chatActionWatchingAnimations with the text of the message needs to be sent if the sticker is played

sticker.description: The animated sticker to be played

updateAnimationSearchParameters.description: The parameters of animation search through getOption("animation_search_bot_username") bot has changed

provider.description: Name of the animation search provider

emojis.description: The new list of emojis suggested for searching

updateSuggestedActions.description: The list of suggested to the user actions has changed

updateSpeedLimitNotification.description: Download or upload file speed for the user was limited, but it can be restored by subscription to Telegram Premium. The notification can be postponed until a being downloaded or uploaded file is visible to the user. Use getOption("premium_download_speedup") or getOption("premium_upload_speedup") to get expected speedup after subscription to Telegram Premium

is_upload.description: True, if upload speed was limited; false, if download speed was limited

updateContactCloseBirthdays.description: The list of contacts that had birthdays recently or will have birthday soon has changed

close_birthday_users.description: List of contact users with close birthday

updateAutosaveSettings.description: Autosave settings for some type of chats were updated

scope.description: Type of chats for which autosave settings were updated

settings.description: The new autosave settings; may be null if the settings are reset to default

updateBusinessConnection.description: A business connection has changed; for bots only

updateNewBusinessMessage.description: A new message was added to a business account; for bots only

connection_id.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

updateBusinessMessageEdited.description: A message in a business account was edited; for bots only

connection_id.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

updateBusinessMessagesDeleted.description: Messages in a business account were deleted; for bots only

connection_id.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

chat_id.description: Identifier of a chat in the business account in which messages were deleted

message_ids.description: Unique message identifiers of the deleted messages

updateNewInlineQuery.description: A new incoming inline query; for bots only

sender_user_id.description: Identifier of the user who sent the query

chat_type.description: The type of the chat from which the query originated; may be null if unknown

offset.description: Offset of the first entry to return

updateNewChosenInlineResult.description: The user has chosen a result of an inline query; for bots only

sender_user_id.description: Identifier of the user who sent the query

inline_message_id.description: Identifier of the sent inline message, if known

updateNewCallbackQuery.description: A new incoming callback query; for bots only

sender_user_id.description: Identifier of the user who sent the query

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat where the query was sent

message_id.description: Identifier of the message from which the query originated

chat_instance.description: Identifier that uniquely corresponds to the chat to which the message was sent

updateNewInlineCallbackQuery.description: A new incoming callback query from a message sent via a bot; for bots only

sender_user_id.description: Identifier of the user who sent the query

inline_message_id.description: Identifier of the inline message from which the query originated

chat_instance.description: An identifier uniquely corresponding to the chat a message was sent to

updateNewBusinessCallbackQuery.description: A new incoming callback query from a business message; for bots only

sender_user_id.description: Identifier of the user who sent the query

connection_id.description: Unique identifier of the business connection

message.description: The message from the business account from which the query originated

chat_instance.description: An identifier uniquely corresponding to the chat a message was sent to

updateNewShippingQuery.description: A new incoming shipping query; for bots only. Only for invoices with flexible price

sender_user_id.description: Identifier of the user who sent the query

updateNewPreCheckoutQuery.description: A new incoming pre-checkout query; for bots only. Contains full information about a checkout

sender_user_id.description: Identifier of the user who sent the query

currency.description: Currency for the product price

total_amount.description: Total price for the product, in the smallest units of the currency

shipping_option_id.description: Identifier of a shipping option chosen by the user; may be empty if not applicable

order_info.description: Information about the order; may be null

updateNewCustomEvent.description: A new incoming event; for bots only

updateNewCustomQuery.description: A new incoming query; for bots only

updatePoll.description: A poll was updated; for bots only

updatePollAnswer.description: A user changed the answer to a poll; for bots only

voter_id.description: Identifier of the message sender that changed the answer to the poll

option_ids.description: 0-based identifiers of answer options, chosen by the user

updateChatMember.description: User rights changed in a chat; for bots only

actor_user_id.description: Identifier of the user, changing the rights

date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the user rights were changed

invite_link.description: If user has joined the chat using an invite link, the invite link; may be null

via_join_request.description: True, if the user has joined the chat after sending a join request and being approved by an administrator

via_chat_folder_invite_link.description: True, if the user has joined the chat using an invite link for a chat folder

updateNewChatJoinRequest.description: A user sent a join request to a chat; for bots only

user_chat_id.description: Chat identifier of the private chat with the user

invite_link.description: The invite link, which was used to send join request; may be null

updateChatBoost.description: A chat boost has changed; for bots only

updateMessageReaction.description: User changed its reactions on a message with public reactions; for bots only

actor_id.description: Identifier of the user or chat that changed reactions

date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the reactions were changed

updateMessageReactions.description: Reactions added to a message with anonymous reactions have changed; for bots only

date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the reactions were changed

reactions.description: The list of reactions added to the message

updatePaidMediaPurchased.description: Paid media were purchased by a user; for bots only

payload.description: Bot-specified payload for the paid media

getAuthorizationState.description: Returns the current authorization state. This is an offline method. For informational purposes only. Use updateAuthorizationState instead to maintain the current authorization state. Can be called before initialization

setTdlibParameters.description: Sets the parameters for TDLib initialization. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitTdlibParameters

use_test_dc.description: Pass true to use Telegram test environment instead of the production environment

database_directory.description: The path to the directory for the persistent database; if empty, the current working directory will be used

files_directory.description: The path to the directory for storing files; if empty, database_directory will be used

database_encryption_key.description: Encryption key for the database. If the encryption key is invalid, then an error with code 401 will be returned

use_file_database.description: Pass true to keep information about downloaded and uploaded files between application restarts

use_chat_info_database.description: Pass true to keep cache of users, basic groups, supergroups, channels and secret chats between restarts. Implies use_file_database

use_message_database.description: Pass true to keep cache of chats and messages between restarts. Implies use_chat_info_database

use_secret_chats.description: Pass true to enable support for secret chats

api_id.description: Application identifier for Telegram API access, which can be obtained at https://my.telegram.org

api_hash.description: Application identifier hash for Telegram API access, which can be obtained at https://my.telegram.org

system_language_code.description: IETF language tag of the user's operating system language; must be non-empty

device_model.description: Model of the device the application is being run on; must be non-empty

system_version.description: Version of the operating system the application is being run on. If empty, the version is automatically detected by TDLib

setAuthenticationPhoneNumber.description: Sets the phone number of the user and sends an authentication code to the user. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPhoneNumber, or if there is no pending authentication query and the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPremiumPurchase, authorizationStateWaitEmailAddress, authorizationStateWaitEmailCode, authorizationStateWaitCode, authorizationStateWaitRegistration, or authorizationStateWaitPassword

phone_number.description: The phone number of the user, in international format

settings.description: Settings for the authentication of the user's phone number; pass null to use default settings

checkAuthenticationPremiumPurchase.description: Checks whether an in-store purchase of Telegram Premium is possible before authorization. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPremiumPurchase

currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code of the payment currency

amount.description: Paid amount, in the smallest units of the currency

setAuthenticationPremiumPurchaseTransact.description: Informs server about an in-store purchase of Telegram Premium before authorization. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPremiumPurchase

is_restore.description: Pass true if this is a restore of a Telegram Premium purchase; only for App Store

currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code of the payment currency

amount.description: Paid amount, in the smallest units of the currency

setAuthenticationEmailAddress.description: Sets the email address of the user and sends an authentication code to the email address. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitEmailAddress

email_address.description: The email address of the user

resendAuthenticationCode.description: Resends an authentication code to the user. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitCode, the next_code_type of the result is not null and the server-specified timeout has passed, or when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitEmailCode

reason.description: Reason of code resending; pass null if unknown

checkAuthenticationEmailCode.description: Checks the authentication of an email address. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitEmailCode

checkAuthenticationCode.description: Checks the authentication code. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitCode

requestQrCodeAuthentication.description: Requests QR code authentication by scanning a QR code on another logged in device. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPhoneNumber, or if there is no pending authentication query and the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPremiumPurchase, authorizationStateWaitEmailAddress, authorizationStateWaitEmailCode, authorizationStateWaitCode, authorizationStateWaitRegistration, or authorizationStateWaitPassword

other_user_ids.description: List of user identifiers of other users currently using the application

registerUser.description: Finishes user registration. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitRegistration

first_name.description: The first name of the user; 1-64 characters

last_name.description: The last name of the user; 0-64 characters

disable_notification.description: Pass true to disable notification about the current user joining Telegram for other users that added them to contact list

resetAuthenticationEmailAddress.description: Resets the login email address. May return an error with a message "TASK_ALREADY_EXISTS" if reset is still pending. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitEmailCode and authorization_state.can_reset_email_address == true

checkAuthenticationPassword.description: Checks the 2-step verification password for correctness. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPassword

requestAuthenticationPasswordRecovery.description: Requests to send a 2-step verification password recovery code to an email address that was previously set up. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPassword

checkAuthenticationPasswordRecoveryCode.description: Checks whether a 2-step verification password recovery code sent to an email address is valid. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPassword

recoverAuthenticationPassword.description: Recovers the 2-step verification password with a password recovery code sent to an email address that was previously set up. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPassword

new_password.description: New 2-step verification password of the user; may be empty to remove the password

new_hint.description: New password hint; may be empty

sendAuthenticationFirebaseSms.description: Sends Firebase Authentication SMS to the phone number of the user. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitCode and the server returned code of the type authenticationCodeTypeFirebaseAndroid or authenticationCodeTypeFirebaseIos

token.description: Play Integrity API or SafetyNet Attestation API token for the Android application, or secret from push notification for the iOS application

reportAuthenticationCodeMissing.description: Reports that authentication code wasn't delivered via SMS; for official mobile applications only. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitCode

checkAuthenticationBotToken.description: Checks the authentication token of a bot; to log in as a bot. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPhoneNumber. Can be used instead of setAuthenticationPhoneNumber and checkAuthenticationCode to log in

logOut.description: Closes the TDLib instance after a proper logout. Requires an available network connection. All local data will be destroyed. After the logout completes, updateAuthorizationState with authorizationStateClosed will be sent

close.description: Closes the TDLib instance. All databases will be flushed to disk and properly closed. After the close completes, updateAuthorizationState with authorizationStateClosed will be sent. Can be called before initialization

destroy.description: Closes the TDLib instance, destroying all local data without a proper logout. The current user session will remain in the list of all active sessions. All local data will be destroyed. After the destruction completes updateAuthorizationState with authorizationStateClosed will be sent. Can be called before authorization

confirmQrCodeAuthentication.description: Confirms QR code authentication on another device. Returns created session on success

link.description: A link from a QR code. The link must be scanned by the in-app camera

getCurrentState.description: Returns all updates needed to restore current TDLib state, i.e. all actual updateAuthorizationState/updateUser/updateNewChat and others. This is especially useful if TDLib is run in a separate process. Can be called before initialization

setDatabaseEncryptionKey.description: Changes the database encryption key. Usually the encryption key is never changed and is stored in some OS keychain

getPasswordState.description: Returns the current state of 2-step verification

setPassword.description: Changes the 2-step verification password for the current user. If a new recovery email address is specified, then the change will not be applied until the new recovery email address is confirmed

old_password.description: Previous 2-step verification password of the user

new_password.description: New 2-step verification password of the user; may be empty to remove the password

new_hint.description: New password hint; may be empty

set_recovery_email_address.description: Pass true to change also the recovery email address

new_recovery_email_address.description: New recovery email address; may be empty

setLoginEmailAddress.description: Changes the login email address of the user. The email address can be changed only if the current user already has login email and passwordState.login_email_address_pattern is non-empty. The change will not be applied until the new login email address is confirmed with checkLoginEmailAddressCode. To use Apple ID/Google ID instead of an email address, call checkLoginEmailAddressCode directly

resendLoginEmailAddressCode.description: Resends the login email address verification code

checkLoginEmailAddressCode.description: Checks the login email address authentication

getRecoveryEmailAddress.description: Returns a 2-step verification recovery email address that was previously set up. This method can be used to verify a password provided by the user

password.description: The 2-step verification password for the current user

setRecoveryEmailAddress.description: Changes the 2-step verification recovery email address of the user. If a new recovery email address is specified, then the change will not be applied until the new recovery email address is confirmed. If new_recovery_email_address is the same as the email address that is currently set up, this call succeeds immediately and aborts all other requests waiting for an email confirmation

password.description: The 2-step verification password of the current user

checkRecoveryEmailAddressCode.description: Checks the 2-step verification recovery email address verification code

resendRecoveryEmailAddressCode.description: Resends the 2-step verification recovery email address verification code

cancelRecoveryEmailAddressVerification.description: Cancels verification of the 2-step verification recovery email address

requestPasswordRecovery.description: Requests to send a 2-step verification password recovery code to an email address that was previously set up

checkPasswordRecoveryCode.description: Checks whether a 2-step verification password recovery code sent to an email address is valid

recoverPassword.description: Recovers the 2-step verification password using a recovery code sent to an email address that was previously set up

new_password.description: New 2-step verification password of the user; may be empty to remove the password

new_hint.description: New password hint; may be empty

resetPassword.description: Removes 2-step verification password without previous password and access to recovery email address. The password can't be reset immediately and the request needs to be repeated after the specified time

cancelPasswordReset.description: Cancels reset of 2-step verification password. The method can be called if passwordState.pending_reset_date > 0

createTemporaryPassword.description: Creates a new temporary password for processing payments

password.description: The 2-step verification password of the current user

valid_for.description: Time during which the temporary password will be valid, in seconds; must be between 60 and 86400

getTemporaryPasswordState.description: Returns information about the current temporary password

getUser.description: Returns information about a user by their identifier. This is an offline method if the current user is not a bot

getUserFullInfo.description: Returns full information about a user by their identifier

getBasicGroup.description: Returns information about a basic group by its identifier. This is an offline method if the current user is not a bot

getBasicGroupFullInfo.description: Returns full information about a basic group by its identifier

getSupergroup.description: Returns information about a supergroup or a channel by its identifier. This is an offline method if the current user is not a bot

getSupergroupFullInfo.description: Returns full information about a supergroup or a channel by its identifier, cached for up to 1 minute

getSecretChat.description: Returns information about a secret chat by its identifier. This is an offline method

getChat.description: Returns information about a chat by its identifier. This is an offline method if the current user is not a bot

getMessage.description: Returns information about a message. Returns a 404 error if the message doesn't exist

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat the message belongs to

message_id.description: Identifier of the message to get

getMessageLocally.description: Returns information about a message, if it is available without sending network request. Returns a 404 error if message isn't available locally. This is an offline method

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat the message belongs to

message_id.description: Identifier of the message to get

getRepliedMessage.description: Returns information about a non-bundled message that is replied by a given message. Also, returns the pinned message, the game message, the invoice message, the message with a previously set same background, the giveaway message, and the topic creation message for messages of the types messagePinMessage, messageGameScore, messagePaymentSuccessful, messageChatSetBackground, messageGiveawayCompleted and topic messages without non-bundled replied message respectively. Returns a 404 error if the message doesn't exist

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat the message belongs to

getChatPinnedMessage.description: Returns information about a newest pinned message in the chat. Returns a 404 error if the message doesn't exist

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat the message belongs to

getCallbackQueryMessage.description: Returns information about a message with the callback button that originated a callback query; for bots only

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat the message belongs to

getMessages.description: Returns information about messages. If a message is not found, returns null on the corresponding position of the result

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat the messages belong to

message_ids.description: Identifiers of the messages to get

getMessageProperties.description: Returns properties of a message. This is an offline method

getMessageThread.description: Returns information about a message thread. Can be used only if messageProperties.can_get_message_thread == true

getMessageReadDate.description: Returns read date of a recent outgoing message in a private chat. The method can be called if messageProperties.can_get_read_date == true

getMessageViewers.description: Returns viewers of a recent outgoing message in a basic group or a supergroup chat. For video notes and voice notes only users, opened content of the message, are returned. The method can be called if messageProperties.can_get_viewers == true

getMessageAuthor.description: Returns information about actual author of a message sent on behalf of a channel. The method can be called if messageProperties.can_get_author == true

getFile.description: Returns information about a file. This is an offline method

file_id.description: Identifier of the file to get

getRemoteFile.description: Returns information about a file by its remote identifier. This is an offline method. Can be used to register a URL as a file for further uploading, or sending as a message. Even the request succeeds, the file can be used only if it is still accessible to the user. For example, if the file is from a message, then the message must be not deleted and accessible to the user. If the file database is disabled, then the corresponding object with the file must be preloaded by the application

remote_file_id.description: Remote identifier of the file to get

file_type.description: File type; pass null if unknown

loadChats.description: Loads more chats from a chat list. The loaded chats and their positions in the chat list will be sent through updates. Chats are sorted by the pair (chat.position.order, chat.id) in descending order. Returns a 404 error if all chats have been loaded

chat_list.description: The chat list in which to load chats; pass null to load chats from the main chat list

limit.description: The maximum number of chats to be loaded. For optimal performance, the number of loaded chats is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit, even if the end of the list is not reached

getChats.description: Returns an ordered list of chats from the beginning of a chat list. For informational purposes only. Use loadChats and updates processing instead to maintain chat lists in a consistent state

chat_list.description: The chat list in which to return chats; pass null to get chats from the main chat list

limit.description: The maximum number of chats to be returned

searchPublicChat.description: Searches a public chat by its username. Currently, only private chats, supergroups and channels can be public. Returns the chat if found; otherwise, an error is returned

searchPublicChats.description: Searches public chats by looking for specified query in their username and title. Currently, only private chats, supergroups and channels can be public. Returns a meaningful number of results. Excludes private chats with contacts and chats from the chat list from the results

searchChats.description: Searches for the specified query in the title and username of already known chats. This is an offline method. Returns chats in the order seen in the main chat list

query.description: Query to search for. If the query is empty, returns up to 50 recently found chats

limit.description: The maximum number of chats to be returned

searchChatsOnServer.description: Searches for the specified query in the title and username of already known chats via request to the server. Returns chats in the order seen in the main chat list

limit.description: The maximum number of chats to be returned

getRecommendedChats.description: Returns a list of channel chats recommended to the current user

getChatSimilarChats.description: Returns a list of chats similar to the given chat

chat_id.description: Identifier of the target chat; must be an identifier of a channel chat

getChatSimilarChatCount.description: Returns approximate number of chats similar to the given chat

chat_id.description: Identifier of the target chat; must be an identifier of a channel chat

return_local.description: Pass true to get the number of chats without sending network requests, or -1 if the number of chats is unknown locally

openChatSimilarChat.description: Informs TDLib that a chat was opened from the list of similar chats. The method is independent of openChat and closeChat methods

chat_id.description: Identifier of the original chat, which similar chats were requested

getBotSimilarBots.description: Returns a list of bots similar to the given bot

bot_user_id.description: User identifier of the target bot

getBotSimilarBotCount.description: Returns approximate number of bots similar to the given bot

bot_user_id.description: User identifier of the target bot

return_local.description: Pass true to get the number of bots without sending network requests, or -1 if the number of bots is unknown locally

openBotSimilarBot.description: Informs TDLib that a bot was opened from the list of similar bots

bot_user_id.description: Identifier of the original bot, which similar bots were requested

getTopChats.description: Returns a list of frequently used chats

category.description: Category of chats to be returned

limit.description: The maximum number of chats to be returned; up to 30

removeTopChat.description: Removes a chat from the list of frequently used chats. Supported only if the chat info database is enabled

searchRecentlyFoundChats.description: Searches for the specified query in the title and username of up to 50 recently found chats. This is an offline method

limit.description: The maximum number of chats to be returned

addRecentlyFoundChat.description: Adds a chat to the list of recently found chats. The chat is added to the beginning of the list. If the chat is already in the list, it will be removed from the list first

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat to add

removeRecentlyFoundChat.description: Removes a chat from the list of recently found chats

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat to be removed

clearRecentlyFoundChats.description: Clears the list of recently found chats

getRecentlyOpenedChats.description: Returns recently opened chats. This is an offline method. Returns chats in the order of last opening

limit.description: The maximum number of chats to be returned

checkChatUsername.description: Checks whether a username can be set for a chat

chat_id.description: Chat identifier; must be identifier of a supergroup chat, or a channel chat, or a private chat with self, or 0 if the chat is being created

getCreatedPublicChats.description: Returns a list of public chats of the specified type, owned by the user

type.description: Type of the public chats to return

checkCreatedPublicChatsLimit.description: Checks whether the maximum number of owned public chats has been reached. Returns corresponding error if the limit was reached. The limit can be increased with Telegram Premium

type.description: Type of the public chats, for which to check the limit

getSuitableDiscussionChats.description: Returns a list of basic group and supergroup chats, which can be used as a discussion group for a channel. Returned basic group chats must be first upgraded to supergroups before they can be set as a discussion group. To set a returned supergroup as a discussion group, access to its old messages must be enabled using toggleSupergroupIsAllHistoryAvailable first

getInactiveSupergroupChats.description: Returns a list of recently inactive supergroups and channels. Can be used when user reaches limit on the number of joined supergroups and channels and receives the error "CHANNELS_TOO_MUCH". Also, the limit can be increased with Telegram Premium

getSuitablePersonalChats.description: Returns a list of channel chats, which can be used as a personal chat

loadDirectMessagesChatTopics.description: Loads more topics in a channel direct messages chat administered by the current user. The loaded topics will be sent through updateDirectMessagesChatTopic. Topics are sorted by their topic.order in descending order. Returns a 404 error if all topics have been loaded

chat_id.description: Chat identifier of the channel direct messages chat

limit.description: The maximum number of topics to be loaded. For optimal performance, the number of loaded topics is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit, even if the end of the list is not reached

getDirectMessagesChatTopic.description: Returns information about the topic in a channel direct messages chat administered by the current user

chat_id.description: Chat identifier of the channel direct messages chat

topic_id.description: Identifier of the topic to get

getDirectMessagesChatTopicHistory.description: Returns messages in the topic in a channel direct messages chat administered by the current user. The messages are returned in reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing message_id)

chat_id.description: Chat identifier of the channel direct messages chat

topic_id.description: Identifier of the topic which messages will be fetched

from_message_id.description: Identifier of the message starting from which messages must be fetched; use 0 to get results from the last message

offset.description: Specify 0 to get results from exactly the message from_message_id or a negative offset up to 99 to get additionally some newer messages

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 100. If the offset is negative, the limit must be greater than or equal to -offset. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

getDirectMessagesChatTopicMessageByDate.description: Returns the last message sent in the topic in a channel direct messages chat administered by the current user no later than the specified date

chat_id.description: Chat identifier of the channel direct messages chat

topic_id.description: Identifier of the topic which messages will be fetched

date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) relative to which to search for messages

deleteDirectMessagesChatTopicHistory.description: Deletes all messages in the topic in a channel direct messages chat administered by the current user

chat_id.description: Chat identifier of the channel direct messages chat

topic_id.description: Identifier of the topic which messages will be deleted

deleteDirectMessagesChatTopicMessagesByD.description: Deletes all messages between the specified dates in the topic in a channel direct messages chat administered by the current user. Messages sent in the last 30 seconds will not be deleted

chat_id.description: Chat identifier of the channel direct messages chat

topic_id.description: Identifier of the topic which messages will be deleted

min_date.description: The minimum date of the messages to delete

max_date.description: The maximum date of the messages to delete

setDirectMessagesChatTopicIsMarkedAsUnre.description: Changes the marked as unread state of the topic in a channel direct messages chat administered by the current user

chat_id.description: Chat identifier of the channel direct messages chat

setDirectMessagesChatTopicDraftMessage.description: Changes the draft message in the topic in a channel direct messages chat administered by the current user

draft_message.description: New draft message; pass null to remove the draft. All files in draft message content must be of the type inputFileLocal. Media thumbnails and captions are ignored

unpinAllDirectMessagesChatTopicMessages.description: Removes all pinned messages from the topic in a channel direct messages chat administered by the current user

readAllDirectMessagesChatTopicReactions.description: Removes all unread reactions in the topic in a channel direct messages chat administered by the current user

loadSavedMessagesTopics.description: Loads more Saved Messages topics. The loaded topics will be sent through updateSavedMessagesTopic. Topics are sorted by their topic.order in descending order. Returns a 404 error if all topics have been loaded

limit.description: The maximum number of topics to be loaded. For optimal performance, the number of loaded topics is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit, even if the end of the list is not reached

getSavedMessagesTopicHistory.description: Returns messages in a Saved Messages topic. The messages are returned in reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing message_id)

saved_messages_topic_id.description: Identifier of Saved Messages topic which messages will be fetched

from_message_id.description: Identifier of the message starting from which messages must be fetched; use 0 to get results from the last message

offset.description: Specify 0 to get results from exactly the message from_message_id or a negative offset up to 99 to get additionally some newer messages

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 100. If the offset is negative, the limit must be greater than or equal to -offset. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

getSavedMessagesTopicMessageByDate.description: Returns the last message sent in a Saved Messages topic no later than the specified date

saved_messages_topic_id.description: Identifier of Saved Messages topic which message will be returned

date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) relative to which to search for messages

deleteSavedMessagesTopicHistory.description: Deletes all messages in a Saved Messages topic

saved_messages_topic_id.description: Identifier of Saved Messages topic which messages will be deleted

deleteSavedMessagesTopicMessagesByDate.description: Deletes all messages between the specified dates in a Saved Messages topic. Messages sent in the last 30 seconds will not be deleted

saved_messages_topic_id.description: Identifier of Saved Messages topic which messages will be deleted

min_date.description: The minimum date of the messages to delete

max_date.description: The maximum date of the messages to delete

toggleSavedMessagesTopicIsPinned.description: Changes the pinned state of a Saved Messages topic. There can be up to getOption("pinned_saved_messages_topic_count_max") pinned topics. The limit can be increased with Telegram Premium

saved_messages_topic_id.description: Identifier of Saved Messages topic to pin or unpin

is_pinned.description: Pass true to pin the topic; pass false to unpin it

setPinnedSavedMessagesTopics.description: Changes the order of pinned Saved Messages topics

saved_messages_topic_ids.description: Identifiers of the new pinned Saved Messages topics

getGroupsInCommon.description: Returns a list of common group chats with a given user. Chats are sorted by their type and creation date

offset_chat_id.description: Chat identifier starting from which to return chats; use 0 for the first request

limit.description: The maximum number of chats to be returned; up to 100

getChatHistory.description: Returns messages in a chat. The messages are returned in reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing message_id). For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib. This is an offline method if only_local is true

from_message_id.description: Identifier of the message starting from which history must be fetched; use 0 to get results from the last message

offset.description: Specify 0 to get results from exactly the message from_message_id or a negative offset up to 99 to get additionally some newer messages

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 100. If the offset is negative, the limit must be greater than or equal to -offset. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

only_local.description: Pass true to get only messages that are available without sending network requests

getMessageThreadHistory.description: Returns messages in a message thread of a message. Can be used only if messageProperties.can_get_message_thread == true. Message thread of a channel message is in the channel's linked supergroup. The messages are returned in reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing message_id). For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib

message_id.description: Message identifier, which thread history needs to be returned

from_message_id.description: Identifier of the message starting from which history must be fetched; use 0 to get results from the last message

offset.description: Specify 0 to get results from exactly the message from_message_id or a negative offset up to 99 to get additionally some newer messages

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 100. If the offset is negative, the limit must be greater than or equal to -offset. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

deleteChatHistory.description: Deletes all messages in the chat. Use chat.can_be_deleted_only_for_self and chat.can_be_deleted_for_all_users fields to find whether and how the method can be applied to the chat

remove_from_chat_list.description: Pass true to remove the chat from all chat lists

revoke.description: Pass true to delete chat history for all users

deleteChat.description: Deletes a chat along with all messages in the corresponding chat for all chat members. For group chats this will release the usernames and remove all members. Use the field chat.can_be_deleted_for_all_users to find whether the method can be applied to the chat

searchChatMessages.description: Searches for messages with given words in the chat. Returns the results in reverse chronological order, i.e. in order of decreasing message_id. Cannot be used in secret chats with a non-empty query (searchSecretMessages must be used instead), or without an enabled message database. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit. A combination of query, sender_id, filter and topic_id search criteria is expected to be supported, only if it is required for Telegram official application implementation

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat in which to search messages

topic_id.description: Pass topic identifier to search messages only in specific topic; pass null to search for messages in all topics

sender_id.description: Identifier of the sender of messages to search for; pass null to search for messages from any sender. Not supported in secret chats

from_message_id.description: Identifier of the message starting from which history must be fetched; use 0 to get results from the last message

offset.description: Specify 0 to get results from exactly the message from_message_id or a negative offset to get the specified message and some newer messages

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 100. If the offset is negative, the limit must be greater than -offset. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

filter.description: Additional filter for messages to search; pass null to search for all messages

searchMessages.description: Searches for messages in all chats except secret chats. Returns the results in reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing (date, chat_id, message_id)). For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

chat_list.description: Chat list in which to search messages; pass null to search in all chats regardless of their chat list. Only Main and Archive chat lists are supported

offset.description: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned; up to 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

filter.description: Additional filter for messages to search; pass null to search for all messages. Filters searchMessagesFilterMention, searchMessagesFilterUnreadMention, searchMessagesFilterUnreadReaction, searchMessagesFilterFailedToSend, and searchMessagesFilterPinned are unsupported in this function

chat_type_filter.description: Additional filter for type of the chat of the searched messages; pass null to search for messages in all chats

min_date.description: If not 0, the minimum date of the messages to return

max_date.description: If not 0, the maximum date of the messages to return

searchSecretMessages.description: Searches for messages in secret chats. Returns the results in reverse chronological order. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat in which to search. Specify 0 to search in all secret chats

query.description: Query to search for. If empty, searchChatMessages must be used instead

offset.description: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned; up to 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

filter.description: Additional filter for messages to search; pass null to search for all messages

searchSavedMessages.description: Searches for messages tagged by the given reaction and with the given words in the Saved Messages chat; for Telegram Premium users only. Returns the results in reverse chronological order, i.e. in order of decreasing message_id. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

saved_messages_topic_id.description: If not 0, only messages in the specified Saved Messages topic will be considered; pass 0 to consider all messages

tag.description: Tag to search for; pass null to return all suitable messages

from_message_id.description: Identifier of the message starting from which messages must be fetched; use 0 to get results from the last message

offset.description: Specify 0 to get results from exactly the message from_message_id or a negative offset to get the specified message and some newer messages

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 100. If the offset is negative, the limit must be greater than -offset. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

searchCallMessages.description: Searches for call and group call messages. Returns the results in reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing message_id). For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib

offset.description: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned; up to 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

only_missed.description: Pass true to search only for messages with missed/declined calls

searchOutgoingDocumentMessages.description: Searches for outgoing messages with content of the type messageDocument in all chats except secret chats. Returns the results in reverse chronological order

query.description: Query to search for in document file name and message caption

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned; up to 100

searchPublicMessagesByTag.description: Searches for public channel posts containing the given hashtag or cashtag. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

tag.description: Hashtag or cashtag to search for

offset.description: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned; up to 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

searchPublicStoriesByTag.description: Searches for public stories containing the given hashtag or cashtag. For optimal performance, the number of returned stories is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

story_poster_chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat that posted the stories to search for; pass 0 to search stories in all chats

tag.description: Hashtag or cashtag to search for

offset.description: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results

limit.description: The maximum number of stories to be returned; up to 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned stories is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

searchPublicStoriesByLocation.description: Searches for public stories by the given address location. For optimal performance, the number of returned stories is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

offset.description: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results

limit.description: The maximum number of stories to be returned; up to 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned stories is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

searchPublicStoriesByVenue.description: Searches for public stories from the given venue. For optimal performance, the number of returned stories is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

venue_id.description: Identifier of the venue in the provider database

offset.description: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results

limit.description: The maximum number of stories to be returned; up to 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned stories is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

getSearchedForTags.description: Returns recently searched for hashtags or cashtags by their prefix

tag_prefix.description: Prefix of hashtags or cashtags to return

limit.description: The maximum number of items to be returned

removeSearchedForTag.description: Removes a hashtag or a cashtag from the list of recently searched for hashtags or cashtags

clearSearchedForTags.description: Clears the list of recently searched for hashtags or cashtags

clear_cashtags.description: Pass true to clear the list of recently searched for cashtags; otherwise, the list of recently searched for hashtags will be cleared

revoke.description: Pass true to delete the messages for all users

searchChatRecentLocationMessages.description: Returns information about the recent locations of chat members that were sent to the chat. Returns up to 1 location message per user

limit.description: The maximum number of messages to be returned

getChatMessageByDate.description: Returns the last message sent in a chat no later than the specified date. Returns a 404 error if such message doesn't exist

date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) relative to which to search for messages

getChatSparseMessagePositions.description: Returns sparse positions of messages of the specified type in the chat to be used for shared media scroll implementation. Returns the results in reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing message_id). Cannot be used in secret chats or with searchMessagesFilterFailedToSend filter without an enabled message database

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat in which to return information about message positions

filter.description: Filter for message content. Filters searchMessagesFilterEmpty, searchMessagesFilterMention, searchMessagesFilterUnreadMention, and searchMessagesFilterUnreadReaction are unsupported in this function

from_message_id.description: The message identifier from which to return information about message positions

limit.description: The expected number of message positions to be returned; 50-2000. A smaller number of positions can be returned, if there are not enough appropriate messages

saved_messages_topic_id.description: If not 0, only messages in the specified Saved Messages topic will be considered; pass 0 to consider all messages, or for chats other than Saved Messages

getChatMessageCalendar.description: Returns information about the next messages of the specified type in the chat split by days. Returns the results in reverse chronological order. Can return partial result for the last returned day. Behavior of this method depends on the value of the option "utc_time_offset"

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat in which to return information about messages

topic_id.description: Pass topic identifier to get the result only in specific topic; pass null to get the result in all topics; forum topics aren't supported

filter.description: Filter for message content. Filters searchMessagesFilterEmpty, searchMessagesFilterMention, searchMessagesFilterUnreadMention, and searchMessagesFilterUnreadReaction are unsupported in this function

from_message_id.description: The message identifier from which to return information about messages; use 0 to get results from the last message

getChatMessageCount.description: Returns approximate number of messages of the specified type in the chat or its topic

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat in which to count messages

topic_id.description: Pass topic identifier to get number of messages only in specific topic; pass null to get number of messages in all topics

filter.description: Filter for message content; searchMessagesFilterEmpty is unsupported in this function

return_local.description: Pass true to get the number of messages without sending network requests, or -1 if the number of messages is unknown locally

getChatMessagePosition.description: Returns approximate 1-based position of a message among messages, which can be found by the specified filter in the chat and topic. Cannot be used in secret chats

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat in which to find message position

topic_id.description: Pass topic identifier to get position among messages only in specific topic; pass null to get position among all chat messages

filter.description: Filter for message content; searchMessagesFilterEmpty, searchMessagesFilterUnreadMention, searchMessagesFilterUnreadReaction, and searchMessagesFilterFailedToSend are unsupported in this function

getChatScheduledMessages.description: Returns all scheduled messages in a chat. The messages are returned in reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing message_id)

getChatSponsoredMessages.description: Returns sponsored messages to be shown in a chat; for channel chats and chats with bots only

clickChatSponsoredMessage.description: Informs TDLib that the user opened the sponsored chat via the button, the name, the chat photo, a mention in the sponsored message text, or the media in the sponsored message

chat_id.description: Chat identifier of the sponsored message

is_media_click.description: Pass true if the media was clicked in the sponsored message

from_fullscreen.description: Pass true if the user expanded the video from the sponsored message fullscreen before the click

reportChatSponsoredMessage.description: Reports a sponsored message to Telegram moderators

chat_id.description: Chat identifier of the sponsored message

option_id.description: Option identifier chosen by the user; leave empty for the initial request

getSearchSponsoredChats.description: Returns sponsored chats to be shown in the search results

viewSponsoredChat.description: Informs TDLib that the user fully viewed a sponsored chat

sponsored_chat_unique_id.description: Unique identifier of the sponsored chat

openSponsoredChat.description: Informs TDLib that the user opened a sponsored chat

sponsored_chat_unique_id.description: Unique identifier of the sponsored chat

reportSponsoredChat.description: Reports a sponsored chat to Telegram moderators

sponsored_chat_unique_id.description: Unique identifier of the sponsored chat

option_id.description: Option identifier chosen by the user; leave empty for the initial request

removeNotification.description: Removes an active notification from notification list. Needs to be called only if the notification is removed by the current user

notification_group_id.description: Identifier of notification group to which the notification belongs

removeNotificationGroup.description: Removes a group of active notifications. Needs to be called only if the notification group is removed by the current user

max_notification_id.description: The maximum identifier of removed notifications

getMessageLink.description: Returns an HTTPS link to a message in a chat. Available only if messageProperties.can_get_link, or if messageProperties.can_get_media_timestamp_links and a media timestamp link is generated. This is an offline method

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat to which the message belongs

media_timestamp.description: If not 0, timestamp from which the video/audio/video note/voice note/story playing must start, in seconds. The media can be in the message content or in its link preview

for_album.description: Pass true to create a link for the whole media album

in_message_thread.description: Pass true to create a link to the message as a channel post comment, in a message thread, or a forum topic

getMessageEmbeddingCode.description: Returns an HTML code for embedding the message. Available only if messageProperties.can_get_embedding_code

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat to which the message belongs

for_album.description: Pass true to return an HTML code for embedding of the whole media album

getMessageLinkInfo.description: Returns information about a public or private message link. Can be called for any internal link of the type internalLinkTypeMessage

url.description: The message link

translateText.description: Translates a text to the given language. If the current user is a Telegram Premium user, then text formatting is preserved

to_language_code.description: Language code of the language to which the message is translated. Must be one of "af", "sq", "am", "ar", "hy", "az", "eu", "be", "bn", "bs", "bg", "ca", "ceb", "zh-CN", "zh", "zh-Hans", "zh-TW", "zh-Hant", "co", "hr", "cs", "da", "nl", "en", "eo", "et", "fi", "fr", "fy", "gl", "ka", "de", "el", "gu", "ht", "ha", "haw", "he", "iw", "hi", "hmn", "hu", "is", "ig", "id", "in", "ga", "it", "ja", "jv", "kn", "kk", "km", "rw", "ko", "ku", "ky", "lo", "la", "lv", "lt", "lb", "mk", "mg", "ms", "ml", "mt", "mi", "mr", "mn", "my", "ne", "no", "ny", "or", "ps", "fa", "pl", "pt", "pa", "ro", "ru", "sm", "gd", "sr", "st", "sn", "sd", "si", "sk", "sl", "so", "es", "su", "sw", "sv", "tl", "tg", "ta", "tt", "te", "th", "tr", "tk", "uk", "ur", "ug", "uz", "vi", "cy", "xh", "yi", "ji", "yo", "zu"

translateMessageText.description: Extracts text or caption of the given message and translates it to the given language. If the current user is a Telegram Premium user, then text formatting is preserved

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat to which the message belongs

to_language_code.description: Language code of the language to which the message is translated. Must be one of "af", "sq", "am", "ar", "hy", "az", "eu", "be", "bn", "bs", "bg", "ca", "ceb", "zh-CN", "zh", "zh-Hans", "zh-TW", "zh-Hant", "co", "hr", "cs", "da", "nl", "en", "eo", "et", "fi", "fr", "fy", "gl", "ka", "de", "el", "gu", "ht", "ha", "haw", "he", "iw", "hi", "hmn", "hu", "is", "ig", "id", "in", "ga", "it", "ja", "jv", "kn", "kk", "km", "rw", "ko", "ku", "ky", "lo", "la", "lv", "lt", "lb", "mk", "mg", "ms", "ml", "mt", "mi", "mr", "mn", "my", "ne", "no", "ny", "or", "ps", "fa", "pl", "pt", "pa", "ro", "ru", "sm", "gd", "sr", "st", "sn", "sd", "si", "sk", "sl", "so", "es", "su", "sw", "sv", "tl", "tg", "ta", "tt", "te", "th", "tr", "tk", "uk", "ur", "ug", "uz", "vi", "cy", "xh", "yi", "ji", "yo", "zu"

recognizeSpeech.description: Recognizes speech in a video note or a voice note message

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat to which the message belongs

message_id.description: Identifier of the message. Use messageProperties.can_recognize_speech to check whether the message is suitable

rateSpeechRecognition.description: Rates recognized speech in a video note or a voice note message

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat to which the message belongs

is_good.description: Pass true if the speech recognition is good

getChatAvailableMessageSenders.description: Returns the list of message sender identifiers, which can be used to send messages in a chat

setChatMessageSender.description: Selects a message sender to send messages in a chat

message_sender_id.description: New message sender for the chat

sendMessage.description: Sends a message. Returns the sent message

message_thread_id.description: If not 0, the message thread identifier in which the message will be sent

reply_to.description: Information about the message or story to be replied; pass null if none

options.description: Options to be used to send the message; pass null to use default options

reply_markup.description: Markup for replying to the message; pass null if none; for bots only

input_message_content.description: The content of the message to be sent

sendMessageAlbum.description: Sends 2-10 messages grouped together into an album. Currently, only audio, document, photo and video messages can be grouped into an album. Documents and audio files can be only grouped in an album with messages of the same type. Returns sent messages

message_thread_id.description: If not 0, the message thread identifier in which the messages will be sent

reply_to.description: Information about the message or story to be replied; pass null if none

options.description: Options to be used to send the messages; pass null to use default options

input_message_contents.description: Contents of messages to be sent. At most 10 messages can be added to an album. All messages must have the same value of show_caption_above_media

sendBotStartMessage.description: Invites a bot to a chat (if it is not yet a member) and sends it the /start command; requires can_invite_users member right. Bots can't be invited to a private chat other than the chat with the bot. Bots can't be invited to channels (although they can be added as admins) and secret chats. Returns the sent message

bot_user_id.description: Identifier of the bot

parameter.description: A hidden parameter sent to the bot for deep linking purposes (https://core.telegram.org/bots#deep-linking)

sendInlineQueryResultMessage.description: Sends the result of an inline query as a message. Returns the sent message. Always clears a chat draft message

message_thread_id.description: If not 0, the message thread identifier in which the message will be sent

reply_to.description: Information about the message or story to be replied; pass null if none

options.description: Options to be used to send the message; pass null to use default options

result_id.description: Identifier of the inline query result

hide_via_bot.description: Pass true to hide the bot, via which the message is sent. Can be used only for bots getOption("animation_search_bot_username"), getOption("photo_search_bot_username"), and getOption("venue_search_bot_username")

forwardMessages.description: Forwards previously sent messages. Returns the forwarded messages in the same order as the message identifiers passed in message_ids. If a message can't be forwarded, null will be returned instead of the message

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat to which to forward messages

message_thread_id.description: If not 0, the message thread identifier in which the message will be sent; for forum threads only

from_chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat from which to forward messages

message_ids.description: Identifiers of the messages to forward. Message identifiers must be in a strictly increasing order. At most 100 messages can be forwarded simultaneously. A message can be forwarded only if messageProperties.can_be_forwarded

options.description: Options to be used to send the messages; pass null to use default options

send_copy.description: Pass true to copy content of the messages without reference to the original sender. Always true if the messages are forwarded to a secret chat or are local. Use messageProperties.can_be_copied and messageProperties.can_be_copied_to_secret_chat to check whether the message is suitable

remove_caption.description: Pass true to remove media captions of message copies. Ignored if send_copy is false

sendQuickReplyShortcutMessages.description: Sends messages from a quick reply shortcut. Requires Telegram Business subscription. Can't be used to send paid messages

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat to which to send messages. The chat must be a private chat with a regular user

shortcut_id.description: Unique identifier of the quick reply shortcut

sending_id.description: Non-persistent identifier, which will be returned back in messageSendingStatePending object and can be used to match sent messages and corresponding updateNewMessage updates

resendMessages.description: Resends messages which failed to send. Can be called only for messages for which messageSendingStateFailed.can_retry is true and after specified in messageSendingStateFailed.retry_after time passed. If a message is re-sent, the corresponding failed to send message is deleted. Returns the sent messages in the same order as the message identifiers passed in message_ids. If a message can't be re-sent, null will be returned instead of the message

chat_id.description: Identifier of the chat to send messages

message_ids.description: Identifiers of the messages to resend. Message identifiers must be in a strictly increasing order

quote.description: New manually chosen quote from the message to be replied; pass null if none. Ignored if more than one message is re-sent, or if messageSendingStateFailed.need_another_reply_quote == false

paid_message_star_count.description: The number of Telegram Stars the user agreed to pay to send the messages. Ignored if messageSendingStateFailed.required_paid_message_star_count == 0

addLocalMessage.description: Adds a local message to a chat. The message is persistent across application restarts only if the message database is used. Returns the added message

chat_id.description: Target chat; channel direct messages chats aren't supported

sender_id.description: Identifier of the sender of the message

reply_to.description: Information about the message or story to be replied; pass null if none

disable_notification.description: Pass true to disable notification for the message

input_message_content.description: The content of the message to be added

message_ids.description: Identifiers of the messages to be deleted. Use messageProperties.can_be_deleted_only_for_self and messageProperties.can_be_deleted_for_all_users to get suitable messages

revoke.description: Pass true to delete messages for all chat members. Always true for supergroups, channels and secret chats

deleteChatMessagesBySender.description: Deletes all messages sent by the specified message sender in a chat. Supported only for supergroups; requires can_delete_messages administrator right

sender_id.description: Identifier of the sender of messages to delete

deleteChatMessagesByDate.description: Deletes all messages between the specified dates in a chat. Supported only for private chats and basic groups. Messages sent in the last 30 seconds will not be deleted

min_date.description: The minimum date of the messages to delete

max_date.description: The maximum date of the messages to delete

revoke.description: Pass true to delete chat messages for all users; private chats only

editMessageText.description: Edits the text of a message (or a text of a game message). Returns the edited message after the edit is completed on the server side

chat_id.description: The chat the message belongs to

message_id.description: Identifier of the message. Use messageProperties.can_be_edited to check whether the message can be edited

reply_markup.description: The new message reply markup; pass null if none; for bots only

input_message_content.description: New text content of the message. Must be of type inputMessageText

editMessageLiveLocation.description: Edits the message content of a live location. Messages can be edited for a limited period of time specified in the live location. Returns the edited message after the edit is completed on the server side

chat_id.description: The chat the message belongs to

message_id.description: Identifier of the message. Use messageProperties.can_be_edited to check whether the message can be edited

reply_markup.description: The new message reply markup; pass null if none; for bots only

location.description: New location content of the message; pass null to stop sharing the live location
